I agree. Thus we may introduce Adorno and underline the importance of theory (theoria) in formatting our people-to-come.

Yes, the work of Theodor Adorno and other critical theorists can be useful in helping us understand the current systems of oppression and exploitation and how they may be transformed. The idea of "theory" or "theoria" as a means of reflecting on and critically analyzing society is crucial in shaping a more equitable future.

Adorno's concept of "negative dialectics" emphasizes the importance of constantly challenging and questioning dominant ideas and systems, rather than accepting them uncritically. This type of critical reflection and analysis can help us identify the root causes of societal problems and work towards developing more just and equitable solutions.

In conclusion, while change towards a better future may be necessary, it must be approached with caution and a critical understanding of the current systems and their effects. The work of theorists such as Adorno can be useful in this endeavor.
